alert.note: Alert for North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:32PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lincoln County through 715 PM MDT... At 631 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles west of Arriba, or 16 miles west of Flagler, moving east at 10 mph along Interstate 70. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Torrential rainfall will make driving difficult. Locations impacted include... Arriba. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding and poor visibility. Slow down to avoid hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
